intro: Ichnanthus calvescens var. scabrior, commonly known as the rough-stemmed wintergreen, is a perennial herb native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough, scaly texture, contributing to its common name. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
